sense.name: goal or objective
sense.commentary: A non-physical goal; an anticipated outcome that guides a person's actions. Usually refers to a sentence- or a verb-clause.
sense.examples: My aim is to have the report finished by tomorrow. My aim is that I'll finish the report tomorrow. It was created with the conscious aim of meeting immediate needs. Even a person with good aims can do harm. John made no secret of his personal aim: to get the high score on Pac Man. The aim of chess is to checkmate the opposing king.

sense.name: goal, as physical location
sense.commentary: The physical thing or location that an object is heading towards. Can also be the general direction of movement.
sense.examples: When I set out on my trip, my original aim was Seattle. Captain, set our aim for the west.

sense.name: pointing at a target
sense.commentary: AIM[+event] The act of pointing or directing an object at something.
sense.examples: He took aim and fired. I saw that the gun's aim was directed at my head. Your aim is a little off.

sense.name: ability to aim
sense.commentary: The ability to aim something. A quality that a person has. Does not refer to any instance of aiming.
sense.examples: John always had terrible aim. Three years in the army has given me good aim.
